subanswer.text:
Let's think step by step. Since Bryce is one of the four friends who ordered pizzas, we can assume the four friends each ordered exactly one pizza. And since Bryce ate 2/3 of his pizza, he left (1 - 2/3) = 1/3 of his pizza uneaten. Two other friends also ate 2/3 of their pizza each. That means they left (1 - 2/3) = 1/3 of their pizza uneaten as well. This means that out of all six friends, there are (4 - 2) = 2 friends left who ate ¾ of their pizza each. We can represent this situation in a table, like so:
| Friend | Pizza (slices) | Eaten (slices) | Uneaten (slices) |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Bryce | 6074464 | 4049643 | 2024821 |
| Friend 1 | 6074464 | 4049643 | 2024821 |
|

ost_step.3: The other friend who ate ¾ of his pizza had initially `(6074464) * (4/3)` slices. After eating ¾ of that amount, he had `(6074464) * (4/3) * (3/4)` slices left, which equals `(1824822)` slices.
